authors.name: Roald Dahl
authors.biography: Roald Dahl was a British novelist, short story writer, poet, screenwriter, and wartime fighter pilot. His books have sold more than 250 million copies worldwide. Dahl has created many unforgettable characters in his books for children. Known for his inventive storytelling, some of his most famous works have been adapted into classic films and stage performances.
authors.influence: Dahl's influence extends beyond literature; his unique style and creativity have inspired various adaptations, including movies, stage plays, and even theme park attractions. His works have also influenced numerous contemporary authors and sparked a love for reading among children for generations.
